qas.question: What year was the largest Presbyterian denomination brought to Mizoram?
Before Mizoram, what was the name of the group of  missionaries that  ventured into east india?
Where did the Welsh Presbyterians build there first church?
During what year was the smallest the first Presbyterian church in Tainan
In what year was Presbyterianism brought to the region from India?
There is a weak presence of Presbyterians in which capital of Meghalaya?
Where did the Welsh missionaries establish their first church in 1894?
Who participated in mergers which created the Church of South Khasi Hills?

context: In the mainly Christian Indian state of Mizoram, the Presbyterian denomination is the largest denomination; it was brought to the region with missionaries from Wales in <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>1894<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/>. Prior to Mizoram, the <a1_0>Welsh Presbyterians<a1_0/> (missionaries) started venturing into the north-east of India through the Khasi Hills (presently located within the state of Meghalaya in India) and established Presbyterian churches all over the Khasi Hills from the 1840s onwards. Hence there is a strong presence of Presbyterians in <b5_0>Shillong<b5_0/> (the present capital of Meghalaya) and the areas adjoining it. The Welsh missionaries built their first church in <a2_0><b6_0>Sohra<b6_0/><a2_0/> (aka Cherrapunji) in 1846. <b7_0>Presbyterians<b7_0/> participated in the mergers that resulted in the Church of North India and the Church of South India.Sohra
